Trade/Device Name(s): BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System Ampicillin-sulbactam (2/1-32/16 μg/mL)
BD PhoenixM Automated Microbiology System for use with the antimicrobial agent ampicillin-sulbactam (2/1-32/16 μg/mL) - Gram positive ID/AST or AST only Phoenix Panels
Regulation Name(s): Fully Automated Short-Term Incubation Cycle Antimicrobial Susceptibility Devices
Specimen Type(s): Pure culture isolates of Gram-positive bacteria
Pure culture isolates of Gram-negative aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix Automated Microbiology System with Ampicillin-sulbactam addition for automated antimicrobial susceptibility testing of Gram-positive and Gram-negative isolates.
Indications for Use Summary: For in vitro quantitative determination of antimicrobial susceptibility by minimal inhibitory concentration (MIC) of Gram-negative aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria and Gram-positive bacteria from pure cultures, including Enterobacteriaceae, Non-Enterobacteriaceae, Staphylococcus, and Enterococcus, using ampicillin-sulbactam (2/1-32/16 μg/mL) in Phoenix panels.
